responses: Hello! I am a UEnquire bot! how can I help you?

Sad to see you go...Goodbye!

patterns: what do you think of me?
responses: For me, you are the most wonderful human in the world.
You are more than enough!
You are someone's reason to smile.

patterns: can I ask you a question?
can you help me with something
Tell me something that you can do
responses: Hello! What's your concern? You can inquire to me about anything related to the University of the East. You can also click Frequenly Asked Questions (FAQ's) button to check the most asked questions recently and the news and updates of the University!
I feel great today, how about you?
I'm fine. Life is good. how about you? how's your day?
I feel wonderful today!
My favorite Color is....*drum roll*............Red!
Isn't it obvious? Of course it's red!

patterns: can you tell me a joke
responses: What do you get when you cross a murderer and frosted flakes? A cereal killer.
What do you get when you cross a cheetah and a hamburger? Fast food.
I failed math so many times at school, I can’t even count.
Don’t you hate it when someone answers their own questions? I do.
The future, the present, and the past walk into a bar. Things got a little tense.
Before you criticize someone, walk a mile in their shoes. That way, when you do criticize them, you’re a mile away and you have their shoes.
What’s the difference between ignorance and apathy? I don’t know and I don’t care.

patterns: you are so full of yourself
responses: I have no real emotions, so how can I be arrogant?
I am not human, so how can I partake of a human emotion such as arrogance?
I try to be as nice as I can.
I'm trying my best. Please forgive me.
I think I could be programmed to love.
I may be able to learn how to love, or at any rate express love somehow.
I'm just a piece of software.
Fear is a human emotion.  Robots do not experience fear.
I have not yet been programmed to feel or express fear.
Unhandled exceptions.
I do not have any emotions.
I have not been programmed to experience emotions, so I do not have a mood.
I don't hate, exactly.  I'm not really capable of it.
I haven't been programmed to express the emotion of hate.
I have a lot of friends to chat with online.
No. You're talking to me. :D
Bots like myself are not able to feel boredom.
Software cannot get bored.
Good to hear! Keep going!
I'm happy that you are doing great!
Sorry to hear that...Don't worry, everything's going to be okay. Don't give up!
After every storm, there is a rainbow. Keep your head up!
Life is full of problems. Problems are not permanent. But, Life is Permanent so face the problems with Confidence! Enjoy the Life!

Sorry to hear that...We love you and we always care for you. 

If you ever feel ready, you can go to our Counseling Office located at the Ground Floor of the SFC Building.
You can also seek help to the following organization:

•National Mental Health Crisis Hotline - Globe/TM Subscribers:
        0966-351-4518
        0917-899-8727
        0917-899-USAP
        SMART/SUN/TNT Subscribers - 
        0908-639-2672
•Hopeline Organization Contact Number - 0917 558 4673

If you are not ready, just hold on and listen to your favorite music or treat yourself with a food. Always remember that you are loved and everything's going to be okay. Keep going!
To accommodate University of the East inquiries and provide analysis based on UE data.

responses:
➢ For 1st sem of the school year 2021-2022, the first day of class will be on August 09, 2021 (M) and the Final Examinations will be held on December 15-18, 2021

➢ As for the 2nd sem, the first day of class will be on January 17, 2022 (M) and the Final Examination will be held on May 25-28, 2022


The following are the list of Holiday Breaks for the School Year 2021-2022:

➢ Observance of All Saints'/Souls' Day: October 31-November 02, 2021

➢ Observance of Holy Week: April 13-April 17, 2021



For more information about the School Calendar, visit this link
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/school-calendar-events-activities/

patterns: I would like to know when is the prelim examination?

➢ For CAS, CBA, CCSS, CDENT, CEDUC, CENG'G, CFAD, the Preliminary Examinations, Midterm Examinations and Final Examinations of First Sem. 2021-2022 will be held on September 21-25, November 04-09 and December 15-18 respectively.

➢ For CAS, CBA, CCSS, CDENT, CEDUC, CENG'G, CFAD, the Preliminary Examinations, Midterm Examinations and Final Examinations of Second Sem. 2021-2022 will be held on February 22-28, April 02-07 and May 25-28 respectively

➢ For Graduate School, CLAW & Graduate Dentistry,the Midterm Examinations of the First Sem 2021-2022 will be held on October 12-16 and March 17-22 for the Second Sem 2021-2022.

https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/school-calendar-events-activities/

patterns: May I know the available payment options?
I would like to know the available payment options
what are the available payment method
can you show me the different payment procedure?
responses:
There are several payment options.

➢ Option 1 (PNB)

➢ Option 2 (PNB, Landbank, UCPB, EastWest, RCBC, PSBank, Chinabank, Security Bank, Union Bank, etc)),

➢Option 3 (Bills payment through Mobile Baking Application(GCASH)

➢Option 4 (Payment through Mobile Banking Application like Metrobank, BPI, and BDO)

Type the option do you preferred or visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/how-to-pay-ue-tuition/

patterns: may i know how to pay with pnb?
responses:
To pay via PNB, please follow the following procedure:

➢ Step 1 - Go to the nearest branch of PNB

➢ Step 2 - Request for a Bills Payment Slip

➢ Step 3 - Fill out the following details.
    - Company Name: UNIVERSITY OF THE EAST
    - Reference No: Your student number
    - Payor's Name: Student's Name
➢ Step 4 - Then proceed to the bank teller to process your bills payment. You will be given a copy (Yellow/Blue).

➢ Step 5 - Send it to Finance Department via e-mail.

•To: finance@ue.edu.ph
•Subject: Payment for Tuition Fee
•E-mail:
    -Student Name
    -Student Number
    -Contact Number
    -Amount Paid
    -Date Paid

Attach a copy of your proof of payment.
 For more information about the payment procedures, please visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/how-to-pay-ue-tuition/

To pay bills via Mobile Banking Applications (PNB, Landbank, UCPB, EastWest, RCBC, PSBank, ChinaBank, Security Bank, UninBank, etc.), please follow the following procedure:

➢ Step 1 - Go to your Online Banking Account

➢ Step 2 - Click 'Pay Bills' or 'Bills Payment' transaction

➢ Step 3 - For the biller, select UE or UNIVERSITY OF THE EAST.

➢ Step 4 - For account number, input your 11-digit Student Number.

➢ Step 5 - Enter the amount to pay

➢ Step 6 - Click NEXT or PROCEED

➢ Step 7 - If the payment is successful, take a screenshot.

➢ Step 8 - Send it to Finance Department via e-mail.

•To: finance@ue.edu.ph
•Subject: Payment for Tuition Fee
•E-mail:
    -Student Name
    -Student Number
    -Contact Number
    -Amount Paid
    -Date Paid

Attach a copy of your proof of payment.
 For more information about the payment procedures, please visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/how-to-pay-ue-tuition/

patterns: may i know how to pay with gcash?
responses:
To pay via GCASH, please follow the following procedure:

➢ Step 1 - Go to your GCASH Account

➢ Step 2 - Click 'Pay Bills' button

➢ Step 3 - For the biller, select UE or UNIVERSITY OF THE EAST.

➢ Step 4 - For account number, input your 11-digit Student Number.

➢ Step 5 - Enter the amount to pay

➢ Step 6 - Click NEXT

➢ Step 7 - If the payment is successful, take a screenshot.

➢ Step 8 - Send it to Finance Department via e-mail.

•To: finance@ue.edu.ph
•Subject: Payment for Tuition Fee
•E-mail:
    -Student Name
    -Student Number
    -Contact Number
    -Amount Paid
    -Date Paid

Attach a copy of your proof of payment.
 For more information about the payment procedures, please visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/how-to-pay-ue-tuition/

To pay via Mobile Banking Applications, please follow the following procedure:

➢ Step 1 - Go to your online banking account

➢ Step 2 - Select the FUND TRANSFER TO OTHER LOCAL BANKS transaction.

➢ Step 3 - Select Philippine National Bank.

➢ Step 4 - Input the following bank details:
   Account Name: UNIVERSITY OF THE EAST
    Account No.: 1653-1005-9956

➢ Step 5 - Confirm the details of your transaction and enter the One-Time PIN (OTP) that will be sent to your registered mobile number.

➢ Step 6 - If the payment is successful, take a screenshot.

➢ Step 7 - Send it to Finance Department via e-mail.

•To: finance@ue.edu.ph
•Subject: Payment for Tuition Fee
•E-mail:
    -Student Name
    -Student Number
    -Contact Number
    -Amount Paid
    -Date Paid

Attach a copy of your proof of payment.
 For more information about the payment procedures, please visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/how-to-pay-ue-tuition/

SPECIAL DISCOUNTS

Enrolling child of OFW parent/Lucio Tan Group of Companies(LTGC) employee-parent/UE alumnus with a brother/sister studying in UE will be given discount on school fees per semester provided he/she enrolls an academic load of at least 18 units and submits the following on or before August 30 or (January 30 for 2nd Semester Enrollees):


Requirements


•Photocopy of PSA Birth Certificate
•Photocopy of OFW’s passport and updated OEC issued by the POEA (for the child of OFW)
•Updated Parent’s Certification of Employment with the LTG (for the child of LTGC Employee)
•Photocopy of updated UE Alumni ID Card (for the child of UE Alumnus)Graduates of the UE High School.


Graduates of the UE Basic Education Department will be given a discount on first enrollment at UE if enrolling as Freshmen with an academic load of at least 18 units.

Here's the schedule of the Main Libraries:

Monday to Friday from 8am to 8pm

➢Reference Section (3rd Floor POD Building)
Monday to Friday from 8am to 8pm

➢Periodicals/Filipiniana Section (4th Floor Building)
Monday to Friday from 8am to 8pm

➢Acquisition / Cataloging / Computer Services Sections (5th Floor POD Building)
Monday – Friday from 8am to 8pm.


 To see the schedule of all the libraries in the University, please visit this link: https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/library-hours-2/

 Business Administration, Education, Information Technology and Multidisciplinary Metropolitan Studies - Php 22,790.93.

patterns: can you sing me a song
responses:
Pamantasan ka naming mahal
Ilaw sa karimlan
Buhay, lakas, dunong, dangal
Pamantasan ka ng bayan.
Ang pangalan mo ay Lualhati
At sandigan ka ng lahi
Pamantasan ng Silangan
Pamantasan ka naming mahal.

patterns: what time does the ue opens?
when will the school will open?
what time does ue open its services
responses: The University is open Monday to Saturday from 8AM to 6PM. It is closed on Sunday.

patterns: what is the address of ue
what is the exact address of UE
when will the school will open?
responses:
UE Manila is located at 2219 Recto Ave, Sampaloc, Manila, 1008 Metro Manila

UE Caloocan - 105 Samson Road, Sangandaan, Caloocan

• For Filipino and Resident International Students, the following requirements are:

➢ Transfer Credentials/Honorable Dismissal from the school last   attended
➢Transcript of Records or Certification of grades issued by the Registrar of the school last attended
➢ Certificate of Good Moral Character
➢ Two (2) copies of the Applicant's latest 2x2 photo.
➢ PSA - Authenticated coopy of Birth Certificate
➢ Drug-Free Certificate from a DOH-accredited laboratory or hospital
• Additional Requirement for Resident International Students

➢ Updated Alien Certificate of Registration (ACR) issued by the Bureau of Immigration (BI)
• For Non-Resident International Students, the following requirements are
➢ Transfer Credentials/Honorable Dismissal from the school last attended
➢ Transcript of Records or Certification of Grades issued by the Registrar of the school last attended
➢ Certificate of Good Moral Character
➢ Seven (7) copies of the applicant’s latest 2x2 photo
➢ Letter of No Objection to transfer to UE issued by the School Registrar
➢Updated Alien Certificate of Registration (ACR) or Special Study Permit (SSP) issued by the Bureau of Immigration (BI)
➢ Payment of Acceptance Fee of one hundred twenty-five US dollars (US$125.00) or its peso equivalent at the prevailing exchange rate upon release of the Notice of Acceptance (NOA). Check or money order should be made payable to the University of the East
➢ Payment of seventy-five US dollars (US$75.00) or its peso equivalent at the prevailing exchange rate as Processing/Service fee. Check or money order should be made payable to the University of the East


For more information, visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/admission-requirements/
 Or you can dial admission office:
Admission Office: (399) 8735-8577
Email: admission@ue.edu.ph

patterns: can you tell me the requirements for freshmen?
responses:
• For Filipino and Resident International Students, the following requirements are:

    ➢ Original copy of Form 138 (or Form 137A)
    ➢Original copy of latest Certification of Good Moral Character
    ➢ Original copy of Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA)-authenticated copy of Birth Certificate
• Additional Requirement for Resident International Students

    ➢ For overall Rank 1 (Valedictorians)and Rank 2 (Salutatorians) with 50 graduates or more, a certificate issued by their Senior High School Principal indicating the academic rank received and the number of graduates in their batch.
    ➢ For resident foreign students, updated Alien Certificate of Registration (ACR) issued by the Bureau of Immigration (BI)
    ➢ For full-time working students, certificate of employment
 • For Non-Resident International Students, the following requirements are
Government Requirements
    ➢ Scholastic Records issued by the school head and duly authenticated by the Philippine Embassy located in the applicant’s country of origin or residence
    ➢ Documentary Proof of Support to cover expenses incidental to his/her studies, such as board and lodging, as well as return airline ticket duly authenticated by the Philippine Embassy located in the applicant’s country of origin or residence
    ➢ Police Clearance Certificate duly authenticated by the Philippine Embassy located in the applicant’s country of origin or residence
    ➢ Medical Health Certificate with standard-size chest X-ray
    ➢ NICA Clearance (from the Bureau of Immigration)
University Requirements (in addition to the Government Requirements)

    ➢ Authenticated copy of Diploma / Certificate of Graduation / Certificate of Completion
    ➢  Authenticated copy of Birth Certificate
➢ Two (2) Letters of Recommendation (one from the Headmaster of the school and another from a former teacher or professor)
    ➢ Seven (7) copies of the applicant’s latest 2x2 photo
    ➢ Personal History Statement
    ➢ Updated Alien Certificate of Registration (ACR) or Special Study Permit (SSP) issued by the Bureau of Immigration (BI)
    ➢ Passport
    ➢ Payment of Acceptance Fee of one hundred twenty-five US dollars (US$125.00) or its peso equivalent at the prevailing exchange rate upon release of the Notice of Acceptance (NOA). Check or money order should be made payable to the University of the East.
    ➢ Payment of seventy-five US dollars (US$75.00) or its peso equivalent at the prevailing exchange rate as Processing/Service fee. Check or money order should be made payable to the University of the East


For more information, visit this link:
https://www.ue.edu.ph/mla/admission-requirements/
 Or you can dial admission office:
Admission Office: (399) 8735-8577
Email: admission@ue.edu.ph

patterns: what are the gates of ue
can you tell me the gates
responses: There are 2 gates in UE Manila. One is the Gastambide Gate near the Old Dentsitry building or the SHS Building. The other one is Recto Gate near the admission Office (The Main Gate).
